types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.name: createMissing
fields.description: creates missing objects if needed - only applicable for performers, tags and studios

inputFields.name: createMissing
inputFields.description: creates missing objects if needed - only applicable for performers, tags and studios

enumValues.name: MERGE
enumValues.description:
For multi-value fields, merge with existing.
For single-value fields, ignore if already set

enumValues.name: OVERWRITE
enumValues.description:
Always replaces the value if a value is found.
For multi-value fields, any existing values are removed and replaced with the
scraped values.

fields.name: migrate
fields.description: Migrates the schema to the required version. Returns the job ID

fields.name: downloadFFMpeg
fields.description: Downloads and installs ffmpeg and ffprobe binaries into the configuration directory. Returns the job ID.

fields.name: sceneIncrementO
fields.description: Increments the o-counter for a scene. Returns the new value

fields.name: sceneDecrementO
fields.description: Decrements the o-counter for a scene. Returns the new value

fields.name: sceneAddO
fields.description: Increments the o-counter for a scene. Uses the current time if none provided.

fields.name: sceneDeleteO
fields.description: Decrements the o-counter for a scene, removing the last recorded time if specific time not provided. Returns the new value

fields.name: sceneResetO
fields.description: Resets the o-counter for a scene to 0. Returns the new value

fields.name: sceneSaveActivity
fields.description: Sets the resume time point (if provided) and adds the provided duration to the scene's play duration

fields.name: sceneResetActivity
fields.description: Resets the resume time point and play duration

fields.name: sceneIncrementPlayCount
fields.description: Increments the play count for the scene. Returns the new play count value.

fields.name: sceneAddPlay
fields.description: Increments the play count for the scene. Uses the current time if none provided.

fields.name: sceneDeletePlay
fields.description: Decrements the play count for the scene, removing the specific times or the last recorded time if not provided.

fields.name: sceneResetPlayCount
fields.description: Resets the play count for a scene to 0. Returns the new play count value.

fields.name: sceneGenerateScreenshot
fields.description: Generates screenshot at specified time in seconds. Leave empty to generate default screenshot

fields.name: imageIncrementO
fields.description: Increments the o-counter for an image. Returns the new value

fields.name: imageDecrementO
fields.description: Decrements the o-counter for an image. Returns the new value

fields.name: imageResetO
fields.description: Resets the o-counter for a image to 0. Returns the new value

fields.name: reorderSubGroups
fields.description: Reorder sub groups within a group. Returns true if successful.

fields.name: moveFiles
fields.description:
Moves the given files to the given destination. Returns true if successful.
Either the destination_folder or destination_folder_id must be provided.
If both are provided, the destination_folder_id takes precedence.
Destination folder must be a subfolder of one of the stash library paths.
If provided, destination_basename must be a valid filename with an extension that
matches one of the media extensions.
Creates folder hierarchy if needed.

fields.name: configureGeneral
fields.description: Change general configuration options

fields.name: configurePlugin
fields.description: overwrites the entire plugin configuration for the given plugin

fields.name: configureUI
fields.description:
overwrites the UI configuration
if input is provided, then the entire UI configuration is replaced
if partial is provided, then the partial UI configuration is merged into the existing UI configuration

fields.name: configureUISetting
fields.description:
sets a single UI key value
key is a dot separated path to the value

fields.name: generateAPIKey
fields.description: Generate and set (or clear) API key

fields.name: exportObjects
fields.description: Returns a link to download the result

fields.name: importObjects
fields.description: Performs an incremental import. Returns the job ID

fields.name: metadataImport
fields.description: Start an full import. Completely wipes the database and imports from the metadata directory. Returns the job ID

fields.name: metadataExport
fields.description: Start a full export. Outputs to the metadata directory. Returns the job ID

fields.name: metadataScan
fields.description: Start a scan. Returns the job ID

fields.name: metadataGenerate
fields.description: Start generating content. Returns the job ID

fields.name: metadataAutoTag
fields.description: Start auto-tagging. Returns the job ID

fields.name: metadataClean
fields.description: Clean metadata. Returns the job ID

fields.name: metadataCleanGenerated
fields.description: Clean generated files. Returns the job ID

fields.name: metadataIdentify
fields.description: Identifies scenes using scrapers. Returns the job ID

fields.name: migrateHashNaming
fields.description: Migrate generated files for the current hash naming

fields.name: migrateSceneScreenshots
fields.description: Migrates legacy scene screenshot files into the blob storage

fields.name: migrateBlobs
fields.description: Migrates blobs from the old storage system to the current one

fields.name: anonymiseDatabase
fields.description: Anonymise the database in a separate file. Optionally returns a link to download the database file

fields.name: optimiseDatabase
fields.description: Optimises the database. Returns the job ID

fields.name: reloadScrapers
fields.description: Reload scrapers

fields.name: setPluginsEnabled
fields.description:
Enable/disable plugins - enabledMap is a map of plugin IDs to enabled booleans.
Plugins not in the map are not affected.

fields.name: runPluginTask
fields.description:
Run a plugin task.
If task_name is provided, then the task must exist in the plugin config and the tasks configuration
will be used to run the plugin.
If no task_name is provided, then the plugin will be executed with the arguments provided only.
Returns the job ID

args.name: task_name
args.description: if provided, then the default args will be applied

fields.name: runPluginOperation
fields.description:
Runs a plugin operation. The operation is run immediately and does not use the job queue.
Returns a map of the result.

fields.name: installPackages
fields.description:
Installs the given packages.
If a package is already installed, it will be updated if needed..
If an error occurs when installing a package, the job will continue to install the remaining packages.
Returns the job ID

fields.name: updatePackages
fields.description:
Updates the given packages.
If a package is not installed, it will not be installed.
If a package does not need to be updated, it will not be updated.
If no packages are provided, all packages of the given type will be updated.
If an error occurs when updating a package, the job will continue to update the remaining packages.
Returns the job ID.

fields.name: uninstallPackages
fields.description:
Uninstalls the given packages.
If an error occurs when uninstalling a package, the job will continue to uninstall the remaining packages.
Returns the job ID

fields.name: submitStashBoxFingerprints
fields.description: Submit fingerprints to stash-box instance

fields.name: submitStashBoxSceneDraft
fields.description: Submit scene as draft to stash-box instance

fields.name: submitStashBoxPerformerDraft
fields.description: Submit performer as draft to stash-box instance

fields.name: backupDatabase
fields.description: Backup the database. Optionally returns a link to download the database file

fields.name: querySQL
fields.description: DANGEROUS: Execute an arbitrary SQL statement that returns rows.

fields.name: execSQL
fields.description: DANGEROUS: Execute an arbitrary SQL statement without returning any rows.

fields.name: stashBoxBatchPerformerTag
fields.description: Run batch performer tag task. Returns the job ID.

fields.name: stashBoxBatchStudioTag
fields.description: Run batch studio tag task. Returns the job ID.

fields.name: enableDLNA
fields.description: Enables DLNA for an optional duration. Has no effect if DLNA is enabled by default

fields.name: disableDLNA
fields.description: Disables DLNA for an optional duration. Has no effect if DLNA is disabled by default

fields.name: addTempDLNAIP
fields.description: Enables an IP address for DLNA for an optional duration

fields.name: removeTempDLNAIP
fields.description: Removes an IP address from the temporary DLNA whitelist

fields.name: findScene
fields.description: Find a scene by ID or Checksum

fields.name: findScenes
fields.description: A function which queries Scene objects

fields.name: findDuplicateScenes
fields.description:
Returns any groups of scenes that are perceptual duplicates within the queried distance
and the difference between their duration is smaller than durationDiff

args.name: duration_diff
args.description:
Max difference in seconds between files in order to be considered for similarity matching.
Fractional seconds are ok: 0.5 will mean only files that have durations within 0.5 seconds between them will be matched based on PHash distance.

args.name: locale
args.description: Desired collation locale. Determines the order of the directory result. eg. 'en-US', 'pt-BR', ...

inputFields.name: group_id
inputFields.description: ID of the group to reorder sub groups for

inputFields.name: sub_group_ids
inputFields.description:
IDs of the sub groups to reorder. These must be a subset of the current sub groups.
Sub groups will be inserted in this order at the insert_index

inputFields.name: insert_at_id
inputFields.description: The sub-group ID at which to insert the sub groups

inputFields.name: insert_after
inputFields.description: If true, the sub groups will be inserted after the insert_index, otherwise they will be inserted before

fields.name: rows_affected
fields.description:
The number of rows affected by the query, usually an UPDATE, INSERT, or DELETE.
Not all queries or databases support this feature.

fields.name: last_insert_id
fields.description:
The integer generated by the database in response to a command.
Typically this will be from an "auto increment" column when inserting a new row.
Not all databases support this feature, and the syntax of such statements varies.

fields.name: columns
fields.description: The column names, in the order they appear in the result set.

fields.name: rows
fields.description: The returned rows.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: provide ID to overwrite existing filter

fields.name: filter
fields.description: JSON-encoded filter string

fields.name: per_page
fields.description: use per_page = -1 to indicate all results. Defaults to 25.

types.name: Time
types.description: An RFC3339 timestamp

types.name: Timestamp
types.description:
Timestamp is a point in time. It is always output as RFC3339-compatible time points.
It can be input as a RFC3339 string, or as "<4h" for "4 hours in the past" or ">5m"
for "5 minutes in the future"

types.name: Upload
types.description: A multipart file upload

directives.name: defer
directives.description: The @defer directive may be specified on a fragment spread to imply de-prioritization, that causes the fragment to be omitted in the initial response, and delivered as a subsequent response afterward. A query with @defer directive will cause the request to potentially return multiple responses, where non-deferred data is delivered in the initial response and data deferred delivered in a subsequent response. @include and @skip take precedence over @defer.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: The @deprecated built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate deprecated portions of a GraphQL service's schema, such as deprecated fields on a type, arguments on a field, input fields on an input type, or values of an enum type.

directives.name: include
directives.description: The @include directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional inclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: The @skip directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional exclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: The @specifiedBy built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to provide a scalar specification URL for specifying the behavior of custom scalar types.
